Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource

Class Spellsource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.Spellsource
  • public class Spellsource
extends java.lang.Object
    The Spellsource Server API. Access it with spellsource().

    This class provides an easy way to provide a new persist attribute with persistAttribute(String, GameEventType, Attribute, SuspendableAction1).

    It will provide more APIs for features in the future.

    When adding new collections, this class stores the migrations where index creation is appropriate.

    See Also:
    for the entry point of the executable.

      • persistAttribute

        public <T extends GameEvent> Spellsource persistAttribute​(java.lang.String id,
                                                          GameEventType event,
                                                          Attribute attribute,
                                                          co.paralleluniverse.strands.SuspendableAction1<PersistenceContext<T>> handler)
        Persist an attribute when the given game event occurs, using the provided handler to compute the new value and to persist it with a PersistenceContext.update(EntityReference, Object) call inside the handler.

        For example, let's say we want to persist the total amount of damage a minion has dealt: 

             
     		Spellsource.Spellsource().persistAttribute(
              "total-damage-dealt-1",
              GameEventType.AFTER_PHYSICAL_ATTACK,
              Attribute.LIFETIME_DAMAGE_DEALT,
              (PersistenceContext<AfterPhysicalAttackEvent> context) -> {
                  int attackerDamage = context.event().getDamageDealt();
                  context.update(context.event().getAttacker().getReference(), attackerDamage);
              }
          );
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the event that corresponds to the provided GameEventType.
        Parameters:
        id - A name of your choosing to uniquely identify this persistence handler.
        event - The type of event that this handler should be triggered for.
        attribute - The attribute this handler will be persisting.
        handler - A handler that is passed a PersistenceContext, whose methods provide the event and a mechanism to update the entity with a new attribute value (both in the GameContext where this event is currently taking place and in the entity's corresponding InventoryRecord where the value will be persisted in a database.

      • trigger

        public Spellsource trigger​(java.lang.String id,
                           EventTriggerDesc eventTriggerDesc,
                           Spell spell)
        Configures a trigger to be added to the start of every game.
        Parameters:
        id - An ID for this trigger.
        eventTriggerDesc - The event this trigger should listen for.
        spell - The spell that should be casted by this event trigger desc.
        Returns:
        This Spellsource instance.

        Parameters:

        deployments - A handler for the successful deployments. If any deployment fails, the entire handler fails.
